{"id":941603844,"question_id":2764,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"1 year, 1 month","timestamp":1682780278,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"8 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/941603844/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Maximum Number of Fish in a Grid","memory":"42.8 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    public int findMaxFish(int[][] grid) {\n        int res = 0;\n        int h = grid.length;\n        int w = grid[0].length;\n        \n        Queue<int[]> q = new LinkedList<>();\n        \n        boolean[][] seen = new boolean[h][w];\n        \n        for(int i=0; i<h; i++){\n            for(int j=0; j<w; j++){\n                \n                if(grid[i][j]!=0 && seen[i][j]==false){\n                    seen[i][j]=true;\n                    int val =  bfs(grid, i, j, seen, grid[i][j] );\n                    res = Math.max(res, val);\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        return res;\n    }\n    \n    int[][] dirs = new int[][]{{0,1}, {1,0}, {-1,0}, {0,-1}};\n    \n    private int bfs(int[][] grid, int i, int j, boolean[][] seen, int cur){\n        \n        int h = grid.length;\n        int w = grid[0].length;\n        \n        int res= cur;\n        \n        for(int[] d : dirs){\n            \n            int r = d[0]+i;\n            int c = d[1]+j;\n            \n            if(r<0 || c<0 || r>=h || c>=w || seen[r][c] || grid[r][c]==0)\n                continue;\n            seen[r][c]=true;\n            res += bfs(grid, r, c, seen, grid[r][c]);\n            \n        }\n        \n        return res;\n        \n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"maximum-number-of-fish-in-a-grid","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
